title: Ancient Amazonians created mysterious ‘dark earth’ on purpose
description: Soil study suggests today’s Indigenous Amazonians are making new terra preta

title: How much stuff does it take to not be poor? About 6 tons per year
description: That’s the average amount of food, fuel, clothing, and other supplies per person, researchers calculate in first-of-its-kind study

title: Worms with spider genes spin silk tougher than bulletproof Kevlar
description: Milestone advance in silkworms could lead to commercial applications in medicine and textiles

title: Half-million-year-old ‘Lincoln Logs’ may be first wood structure made by ancient humans
description: Interlocking timber unearthed in Zambia may have been part of a platform, bridge, or house foundation
